title: Antidotes to Fear: Optimizing Challenges to Manifest Grace, Gratitude and Humility
description:
In this video, Michael and I discuss 2020 and connect it to the concept of optimization over constraint satisfaction.

I highly recommend following Nancy Hillis who writes 
the artist's blog that references constraint satisfaction and optimization.
In each blog post, she discusses art, psychology and science.
https://www.artistsjourney.com/creativity-complexity-search-for-resolution

The Daily Office app to which Michael referred:  https://www.rethinkme.com/dailyprayer/

Absolutely everything in an animated movie is a result of choice.
Here's Jordan Peterson discussing that idea:  https://youtu.be/uMSmt6yp-E4

Michael asserts that we have a desire for truth and that nobody wants to be deceived. Karen is not so sure.

We reference Paul VanderKlay's video with John Vervaeke which posits God as the ancient solution to the frame problem. https://youtu.be/BqinRbjqy2c

What is nature? What is grace? What has changed? Our ability to perceive.

Challenges are opportunities to see grace in action.

Fear - of losing ourselves, of losing our possessions.  Remember that everything is given to us as a gift.

We now have better quantitative measures of the extent of our ignorance and yet, the heart has not produced humility.

We have lost the sense of wonder of the first humans looking at the night sky.

I highly recommend following Nancy Hillis who writes 
the artist's blog that references constraint satisfaction and optimization.
In each blog post, she discusses art, psychology and science.
https://www.artistsjourney.com/creativity-complexity-search-for-resolution

The Daily Office app to which Michael referred:  https://www.rethinkme.com/dailyprayer/

Absolutely everything in an animated movie is a result of choice.
Here's Jordan Peterson discussing that idea:  https://youtu.be/uMSmt6yp-E4
